statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Lazeric Jones scored 15 points in his Division I debut and UCLA routed Cal State Northridge 83-50 in the teams' season opener Friday night.

related.description: UCLA will leave John Wooden's seat empty heading into the first season without the coach.
related.linkText: UCLA starts season with empty seat for Wooden
related.title: UCLA starts season with empty seat for John Wooden
related.headline: John Wooden seat left empty

article.headline: Lazeric Jones helps UCLA control Cal State Northridge from start
article.linkText: Jones leads UCLA to rout of CSUN to open year

inlines.body:
More On UCLA

For the latest news on all things UCLA, check out the Bruins blog. Blog

article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Lazeric Jones scored 15 points in his Division I debut and UCLA routed Cal State Northridge 83-50 in the teams' season opener Friday night. Jones, a junior college transfer from Chicago, started at point guard, a job he took away from Jerime Anderson. Jones was 6 of 7 from the floor, hit both of his 3-point attempts and had four assists. Reeves Nelson added 17 points and Tyler Honeycutt had 16 points and six rebounds for the Bruins, who opened last season with a double-overtime loss to Cal State Fullerton on their way to a 14-17 finish. Rashaun McLemore was the only Northridge player in double figures with 10 points. The Bruins led by 41 points -- their largest lead -- with seven minutes remaining. From there, coach Ben Howland cleared his bench. UCLA outscored Northridge 37-9 to open the game and build its largest lead of the half.
